website_summaries.verdict: A warm jacket designed to also keep your child dry without being too heavy or thick.
pros: Good for traveling because it will fit well in a suitcase
Easy for kids to move around in
Doesn't bunch up if it gets wet
cons: Sizing on this coat runs a little large

customer_reviews.title: Great coat!
customer_reviews.text: It's not cold yet (ie haven't tested it in MN winter), but my son likes it and it seems thin enough for proper car seat fit. Nice quality feel to the coat. We bought a size up in case he needs more layers for recess. Edited to say he loves this coat and he says it's warm enough to play outside (they stay inside if wind chill is greater than -10).
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Kat

customer_reviews.title: Too light for winter
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice jacket but way too light for a NY winter. Barely feel the down filling, and wish it was fleece lined at least for a little warmth. It also doesn’t have a hood. It looks good on my son, but he won’t wear it beyond fall. It fits as expected and it’s easy to pack in a school backpack.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the jacket! Only problem is I bought it for our 4 year old (so I bought the size Small which states 4-6)... well it will fit him in a year or two! It’s HUGE on him! But we’ll hold on to it as he will grow in to it before we know it! Love it’s real down :)
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Haynie

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, multipurpose use
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. Great quality. My son uses it for everything from casual school coat to mild-day ski jacket. Not super-thick, I think it is about a 400 fill level jacket. Great liner for under a shell jacket for skiing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Prince

customer_reviews.title: very nice jacket

customer_reviews.author: nara1983

customer_reviews.title: insulated and works perfect for my son who is constantly going
customer_reviews.text: We live in Wyoming, so puffer jackets are essential in my family's wardrobe because they are so warm. this jacket is puffy, insulated and works perfect for my son who is constantly going. The blue is bright and a pretty (manly) color - so I am satisfied with it as much as he is. The down has not come out from the inside yet, and this jacket has plenty of give for a boy who is constantly on the move.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Small for 6 yrs old..looks so cool!
customer_reviews.text: We have the blue one for our elder boy who just turned 6 and is using it first time in this winter season. It fits very well and looks snug-fit, not bulky huge like some other ones. Also, so far he has endured the cold season of northeast with one snow without any complaints of "feeling cold". This jacket is lightweight and easy to pack or carry. Fits nicely in school backpack and in the cubby as well. Marmot is a very good brand and the design of this jacket is such that it makes kid looks "well dressed for winter" instead of "piled with layers for winter" :).
customer_reviews.author: Kanishk

customer_reviews.title: Finally A Puffer Jacket That Is Lightweight And Warm!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few puffer jackets that look great but honestly don't provide much warmth. We wanted to get a puffer jacket for our son and thought we would give this one a try. It proved to be just what we were looking for. The jacket is fairly light weight yet provides a good deal of warmth. It really is not good for rain since it doesn't seem like it will keep moisture out (most puffer jackets I have tried have this problem) but its ability to retain warmth make it worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: FirePepper Red

customer_reviews.title: Top quality construction without unnecessary bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: I hesitate to call this jacket "plain", but it's design is simple. No extra pockets, features, etc... Nonetheless, it's an exceptionally fine jacket. For as light weight as this coat is (less than half the weight of my boy's comparable winter coat), it's remarkably warm. Soft and crazy amounts of comfortable. The cut of the sleeves allows for good range of motion, which since you're shopping for a boy, you'll know is a good thing. While it's not quite waterproof, it doesn't get soaked like other coats we've had in the past. Top quality construction without unnecessary bells and whistles. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kingsriter

customer_reviews.title: MAYBE NOT A WINTER COAT... but quality anyway
customer_reviews.text: Not quite a winter coat but perfect for fall weather. I may be wrong, but I don't think this is heavy enough to deal with a really cold environment. While it may be misleading, it feels sort of light fitting to me. Maybe they have some secret warmish material built into its folds, but I doubt it. I wasn't sure if this would fit my 12-year old boy when I got it, but it fit him perfectly. It's a perfect coat for a cold rainy fall day to keep the moisture out and the warmth in. Excellent purchase for a parent wanting to a warm child.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kennison

customer_reviews.title: Solid coat that’s not puffy but still warm.
customer_reviews.text: My son has been wearing this jacket for a few weeks now and I’ve been pestering him about whether it’s warm enough. He says “yes” every time and has now told me to stop asking. The jacket does not have a very puffy style so it’s much more convenient. He says that the lack of a hood is a downer. Also the zipper is a bit finicky, which is never great on a kid’s jacket. For the price, it seems like a good value. But you’ll also have to get a scarf!

customer_reviews.title: Warm Down Jacket that isn't too puffy

She prefers this jacket to other quilted puffy jacket. She said this keeps her warm in our cold Utah Winter. She adds a hat and gloves and is warm and happy. The quality is very good, too.

The jacket is really nicely built, but not a ton of features. The cuffs are elastic, and no extra liner/cuff. It is quite warm, zippers work well and are easy for my son to use.

product_meta.title: Marmot Boys' Ajax Down Puffer Jacket, Fill Power 600
product_meta.description: The boys' ajax down jacket is a puffer style designed to keep your child warm in cold or damp conditions. This winter-ready jacket is insulated with 600 fill power down and protected with down defender-a moisture-resistant treatment that keeps the coat's insulation from clumping and losing its loft when exposed to wet environments, thus increasing its ability to retain warmth when the weather takes a turn for the worse. The Ajax is also outfitted with zippered hand warmer pockets to keep his fingers toasty, a wind flap to protect the front zipper from drafts, and elastic-bound cuffs that provide a secure fit and help to keep out the cold. Your child's arms will retain full mobility through it all, thanks to the built-in angel-wing movement.
feature_bullets: Boys' down puffer jacket is ideal for winter wear, whether he's creating a snow fort in his own backyard, tackling his first ski slope, or sledding down his favorite hill
Moisture-resistant Down Defender treatment on 600 fill power down keeps you warm in wet conditions
Zippered handwarmer pockets for added warmth; wind flap behind front zipper to block drafts
Elastic-bound cuffs for a secure fit and heat retention
Built-in Angel-Wing Movement design allows for full range of mobility
